intro: Pavetta gardeniifolia var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and emit a mild scent. This variant is distinguished by its shorter floral bracts compared to the typical form of Pavetta gardeniifolia.
